resources.description: National tables - Table 1a: Time series of GCSE and equivalent entries and achievements. Years: 1995/96 to 2012/131 (Revised). Coverage: England.
notes: The years include entries and achievements in previous academic years.
Figures for 2012/13 are revised, all other figures are final.

fields.name: year
notes: E.g. 1997 is school year 1997/98.

fields.name: number-of-pupils
notes: Number of pupils on roll aged 15 at the start of the academic year or at the end of key stage 4.

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-C
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-C or equivalent

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-C-incl-english-and-maths
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-C or equivalent including English and mathematics GCSEs
notes: From 2009/2010 iGCSEs, accredited at time of publication, have been counted as GCSE equivalents and also as English & mathematics GCSEs. Also provided are 2009/10 figures without iGCSEs to be consistent with earlier years’ data.

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-G
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-G or equivalent

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-G-incl-english-and-maths
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-G or equivalent including English and mathematics GCSEs4
notes: From 2009/2010 iGCSEs, accredited at time of publication, have been counted as GCSE equivalents and also as English & mathematics GCSEs. Also provided are 2009/10 figures without iGCSEs to be consistent with earlier years’ data.

All schools include state-funded schools, independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

State-funded schools include academies, free schools, city technology colleges and state-funded special schools but exclude independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

The figures for pupils achieving the English and mathematics subject areas are calculated as a percentage of pupils at the end of key stage 4. The figures for sciences, history or geography and languages achievements are calculated as a percentage of those pupils who were entered in that subject area.

resources.description: National tables - Table 1c: Percentage of pupils making expected progress in English and in mathematics between key stage 2 and key stage 4 by gender. Years: 2007/08 to 2012/13 (Revised). Coverage: England.
notes: Figures for 2012/13 are revised, all other figures are final.

Pupils included are those at the end of key stage 4 who have valid matched KS2 result or teacher assessment. Pupils with no prior attainment record are excluded from the calculation unless they are ungraded or have achieved grade B or above at GCSE. A full explanation of how expected progress is calculated is included in the technical notes of this SFR.
The figures represent the mean average for pupils making expected progress.

State-funded mainstream schools include academies, free schools and city technology colleges but exclude state-funded special schools, independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

State-funded schools include academies, free schools, city technology colleges and state-funded special schools but exclude independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

resources.description: National tables - Table 1d: Percentage of pupils making expected progress1 in English and mathematics between key stage 2 and key stage 4 by key stage 2 attainment level and key stage 4 outcome. Year: 2012/13 (Revised). Coverage: England.
notes: A full explanation of how expected progress is calculated is included in the technical notes of the original dataset.

State-funded mainstream schools include academies, free schools and city technology colleges but exclude state-funded special schools, independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

State-funded schools include academies, free schools, city technology colleges and state-funded special schools but exclude independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.
(x) is used where a figure has been suppressed due to low numbers (1 or 2 pupils) or where secondary suppression has been applied.

resources.description: National tbales - Table 8: GCSE entries and achievements in selected subjects of pupils at the end of key stage 4 in schools (percentage of pupils entering the subject). Year: 2012/132 (Revised). Coverage: England.
notes: For each subject group only one attempt is counted. Where subjects have been combined into a group (e.g. other modern languages) and a pupil has an entry in two or more of those subjects, the entry with the best result is counted.
Includes entries and achievements by these pupils in previous academic years.
The English and English Language subject  lines may not add up to the overall English figure due to rounding.
"Other Sciences" includes double award science and applied science.
"Other Design and Technology" includes all other combined syllabus of which design and technology is the major part.
"Information Technology" includes all other combined syllabus of which design and technology is the major part.
'NA' is used for 'not applicable'.

fields.name: subject_area
notes: This column was added the grouping that in the original Excel files was achieved by using formatting / indentation.

resources.description: National tables - Table 9: GCSE entries and achievements in selected subjects of pupils at the end of key stage 4 in schools (percentage of all pupils). Year: 2012/13 (Revised). Coverage: England.
notes: For each subject group only one attempt is counted. Where subjects have been combined into a group (e.g.other modern languages) and a pupil has an entry in two or more of those subjects, the entry with the best result is counted.
Includes entries and achievements by these pupils in previous academic years.
Some zero percentages will represent small numbers due to rounding.
The English and English language subject  lines may not add up to the overall English figure due to rounding.
English language includes entries and achievements in legacy 'English' GCSEs.
"Other Sciences" includes double award science and applied science.
"Other Design and Technology" includes all other combined syllabus of which design and technology is the major part.
"Information Technology" also includes computer studies, information systems and any combined syllabus of which information technology is the major part.
Motor vehicle studies is grouped with other design and technology; catering studies is grouped with vocational studies.

resources.description: Local Authority tables - Table 17: GCSE and equivalent results of pupils at the end of key stage 4 for each local authority1 and region, including English and Mathematics GCSEs. Year: 2005/06 to 2012/132 (Revised). Coverage: England.
notes: Local authority, region and the Total (state-funded sector) figures cover achievements in state-funded schools only. They do not include pupils recently arrived from overseas and so will not match with state-funded figures in the main tables. The 'England' line above includes all pupils from state-funded schools, independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and  alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.
Figures for 2012/13 are revised, all other figures are final.
In 2009, Cheshire local authority split into Cheshire East and Cheshire West and Chester. Similarly, Bedfordshire local authority split into Bedford and Central Bedfordshire.

Results for Bracknell Forest are affected by more than 100 missing GCSE mathematics results for pupils in one of its schools. The school and local authority results have been suppressed on the performance tables website and will be released once these missing results have been submitted to the Department. The Bracknell Forest figures in this SFR will also be corrected and re-published at this point.
Figures from 2009/10 include iGCSEs.

The figures for pupils achieving the English and mathematics subject areas are calculated as a percentage of pupils at the end of key stage 4. The figures for sciences, history or geography and languages achievements are calculated as a percentage of those pupils who were entered in that subject area.

Local authority, region and the Total (state-funded mainstream sector) figures do not include pupils recently arrived from overseas.
